body:
I'm using oap 8.8.1

Through my efforts, I found that it was generated from the spring security oaurh2 protocol
![aop](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2177178/137086520-8a7dce04-692f-4825-99dc-43d6de067058.png)
This is generated by the spring security OAuth security framework .
Probably I can optimize this with reminders.
OK, I may add something enhancing this later. But, generally, Spring should not do like this.

> Probably I can optimize this with reminders.

Maybe put one condition per line, with some tips. And `tags` condition shares the same confusion, I think.

> > Probably I can optimize this with reminders.
> 
> Maybe put one condition per line, with some tips. And `tags` condition shares the same confusion, I think.

Make sense to me.
Thank you. Can you release a version after modification, and then close the issue so that I can receive notifications

> Thank you. Can you release a version after modification, and then close the issue so that I can receive notifications

Official release is controlled by the PMC, not me. So, I don't know when they call for release.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/137106853-89ff0c80-995d-48bd-b3e6-32f7dfac8196.png)

This is what SkyWalking could do in default.

> stream classdesc serialVersionUID = 7930414337282325166, local class serialVersionUID = 7250238719487042907

@457775987 I read this error again, it makes me feeling, a dynamic field is not the root cause. The instrumentation itself is.

I am not sure when `serialVersionUID` gets changed, does rebooting make `local class serialVersionUID` changed every time?

Also, another question is, does the same application(agent installed) put the AopProxyFactory into the cache? From my understanding, there is one JVM process without agent installed puts the class instance(AopProxyFactory) into the cache, and another JVM process with agent installed read it out, or vice versa. Then, this class structure mismatching happens.

First question: the results of unit tests I use will be different every time serialVersionUID;

The second problem: there are indeed multiple applications. The single sign on system does not have an agent installed. It puts it into the cache and installs the agent's fetch cache

>First question: the results of unit tests I use will be different every time serialVersionUID;

Then this issue has nothing related to new field.

> The second problem: there are indeed multiple applications. The single sign on system does not have an agent installed. It puts it into the cache and installs the agent's fetch cache

This is unexpected case too. But, still, the serialVersionUID changing matters, it means, if you want to put this object into cache by using JdkSerializationRedisSerializer, it is nearly impossible. Maybe we could submit question to ByteBuddy project to ask whether there is a solution.

But even it has, I prefer to ask you looking for solution in the Spring ecosystem. There should be a way to change serializer, mostly JSON or YAML serializer doesn't care about the `serialVersionUID`

I'm trying to change serialization to Jackson. Compared with jdkserializationredisserializer, I have encountered some problems. OAuth and spring security may need to do a lot of work, which has not been solved yet
Could you fix your e2e update? I think other changes would fix this PR, and we have to cost many CI resources to run repeatedly.

> Could you fix your e2e update? I think other changes would fix this PR, and we have to cost many CI resources to run repeatedly.

Yes, I am fixing it.
All issues should be in English. And the upstream is just helping community to enhance plugins or review. We didn't write most of the plugins, and don't know why some works others are not.

As I has explained, this issue will be kept open only. If there is anyone wants to help, we are welcome.
Plugins are contributed from global contributors, the core team doesn't know most of them.

> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13514547/71477042-e1c4ed80-2822-11ea-90c0-ebc6c9ca4d89.png)
> 
> I found the reason: can't use classpath wrapper in IDEA.

Nice!  Thanks bro!

First PR include the overall structure of the new component has merged. The second PR contains the conversion of OTLP protocol to skywalking-data-collect-protoco format. Could you please have a review on this? @wu-sheng @kezhenxu94
https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/pull/5690
Please follow the latest change log style for e2e immigration.

`Ignore mechanism` is fine, as Java has this already. Meanwhile, the sampling is recommended to do in the backend, especially rate policy. Because once you set up sampling at agent side, the metrics, even maybe topology, are not correct any more in the whole SkyWalking.

After many attempts, there are many problems with JSON serialization and its support is not very good. The current solution is to add the skywalking agent system to declare that defaultaopproxyfactory overrides the one provided by spring AOP, and declare a fixed private static final long serialVersionUID = 7930414337282325166l;
Is this problem solved?
The reaponse code is number, you should use greater than.
Read OAL document. And your version is far from the latest.
You need to use `infra-e2e` tool when you resolve conflicts. The v1 e2e framework is being removed.

> You need to use `infra-e2e` tool when you resolve conflicts. The v1 e2e framework is being removed.

Got it.
@youzhagui2006 Hi, I can't reproduce the bug. Could you upload a complete demo that can reproduce this bug?

>Elasticsearch built-in security features are not enabled. Without authentication, your cluster could be accessible to anyone. See https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.13/security-minimal-setup.html to enable security.

Read the log first before submitting an issue.
@mrproliu Consider to add a `getProfileTaskLogs` service in GraphQL. The storage level implementations may or may not need to change.

> getProfileTaskLogs

Is that mean I need to split the task and logs in different GraphQL queries?
We don't have to break protocol, I think. Adding one should be enough.
You submitted discussion, please don't submit duplicate feature request, again.
@wu-sheng Can you please point out the issue which is the original one?
You have submitted the discussion. Both here and discussion make reader confused.
Is this problem fixed?
same problem.

my promblem caused by receiver_jaeger, not receiver_zipkin
Check the latest document, there is no `jaeger` for a long time.

Repo created, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-showcase.

@kezhenxu94 will lead on this repo at the beginning.
We are basically good for now.
wildfly is v25+, and this seems having no volunteer for years.
@hailin0 Any progress about Dubbo 3 in Java?
FYI @Fine0830

First of all, this is not a feature. 
And take a look at demo env, the logs are there.

L2 is not verified, so, we need a data accurate testing, such as count metric.
We should mock an agent data or mesh data to generate one time off report. Then swctl checks the exact number of metric, rather than only greater than 0.
Removing provider2 makes it pointless to have this "cluster" e2e.

> Removing provider2 makes it pointless to have this "cluster" e2e.

It still works as same as previous, once consumer to oap1 and provider to oap2. As that issue mentioned, we never checked whether L2 aggregation works, only data accurate testing could verify that. 2 providers have no difference with one provider from cluster perspective.

If you record https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/7988 and think we should verify L2 aggregation. I'd suggest you try to fix 👇

> sometimes consumer request can't be dispatched to both provider1 and provider2.

That is still an issue when you deal with #7988

> If you record https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/7988 and think we should verify L2 aggregation. I'd suggest you try to fix 👇
> 
> 
> 
> > sometimes consumer request can't be dispatched to both provider1 and provider2.
> 
> 
> 
> That is still an issue when you deal with #7988

We will use different data mocker to test. It will generate mock data, like how we did in TTL testing, then send to specific endpoints of endpoints.
how to  fix it?

> 8.9.0 wouldn't include Jaeger-receiver, AFAIK. And 8.8.1 is out just 20 days, I would say it is too early to set up release date for 8.9.0.

whatever,which version will include Jaeger-receiver recently.in other words，which receiver could replace  Jaeger-receiver now?

`Jaeger-receiver` is not planned anymore. We didn't receive any feedback when it was provided for years. Keeping maintaining that component makes an unnecessary payload, so we have decided to remove it.

Zipkin receiver is there, you could use OpenTelemetry collector to transfer the trace format, because basically, they are nearly same.

> OpenTelemetry

But we use Jaeger to collect  right now,can skywalking 8.4.0 (contain Jaeger-receiver) version support  now ? : )

Are you running a version OAP for different version config files?

I am not sure what is the relationship between 2 graphs.
1. Segments are traces
2. The node on the lines is for out bound traffic. And it shows CPM(calls per minute). It isn't traffic at all.

If you want to ask question, please submit discussion rather than an issue.

The first picture is zero

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43720808/138667164-67c811cf-2e4f-4ca2-8315-0ff1c7542d43.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43720808/138667264-5083bdc7-ac7a-4956-97ba-6b772ddf9b33.png)

Again, these are not the same thing. The IP node(19200) should be the upstream of your service, not downstream. Please read the data more clearly. SkyWalking never generate downstream node according to IP.

You can recreate your own GitHub repo and push.

All discussions on GitHub have to be in English. If you want the community helps, check the details rather than UI.
If something is not there, we don't know what happens unless you provide clue.

> btw, is there any docker repository I can use to push docker image? So as I can test publish-docker on my forked repository...

@mis98zb if you have an account in https://hub.docker.com, just override the `HUB` and test via pushing to your own account, such as 

```
export HUB=kezhenxu94 # your account id
make docker.push
```
